alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 10:35PM AKST until January 01 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Winter Weather Advisories Continue for Dyea as well as along the Haines and Klondike Highways... ...Little to no additional snow is expected for the cities of Haines and Skagway overnight... A warm front continues moving northward up Lynn Canal tonight and has resulted in temperatures near sea level near Lynn Canal warming to above the freezing mark. This has resulted in the precipitation type for Haines and Skagway to begin changing to rain. Further inland, away from the water, and at higher elevations, cold temperatures still persist for Dyea, the Klondike Highway, and out the road along the Haines Highway. Additional snowfall for the upper parts of the highways will continue through the early morning before diminishing. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Dyea, and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...Through 9 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on reduced visibility and slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall rates are expected after midnight near the border. Near Dyea, a wintry mix is expected to transition to all rain overnight as the warmer air continues to move into the area. Near Skagway and Lynn Canal, a wintry mix has already changed over to all rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
